base_note.note_text:
THORACENTESIS NOTE
Date: 2025-01-31
Patient: Joseph Anderson | MRN: 9611682 | Age: 78M
Attending: Dr. Linda Harris, MD
Location: Outpatient Procedure Center, University Hospital

INDICATION: New moderate left pleural effusion on CXR. Patient with history of CHF and recent pneumonia. Diagnostic thoracentesis to evaluate etiology.

PROCEDURE: Ultrasound-guided diagnostic thoracentesis, left

PROCEDURE DETAILS:
Patient seated upright, leaning forward. Ultrasound identified moderate free-flowing left effusion. Entry site marked at 8th ICS posterior axillary line. Skin prepped with chlorhexidine, local anesthesia with 1% lidocaine.

22G needle introduced under real-time ultrasound guidance. Clear yellow fluid aspirated. 50mL removed for diagnostic studies.

POST-PROCEDURE: No pneumothorax on ultrasound. Lung sliding confirmed.

SPECIMENS:
- Cell count with differential
- LDH, protein, glucose
- pH
- Cytology
- Gram stain and culture

FLUID APPEARANCE: Clear, straw-colored

COMPLICATIONS: None

IMPRESSION: Diagnostic thoracentesis completed. Await results to determine transudative vs exudative.

Dr. Linda Harris, MD

code_rationales.32555: Thoracentesis with imaging guidance (ultrasound). Diagnostic only, small volume.

coding_review.overall_assessment: Simple diagnostic thoracentesis with US guidance.

cpt_codes.description: Thoracentesis, needle or catheter, aspiration of the pleural space; with imaging guidance

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32555; total_work_rvu=2.27, total_rvu=3.19 (facility).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Emma Sullivan
Medical Record Number: 6025350
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-04-21

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with new pleural effusion - diagnostic workup. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Thoracentesis:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 32555

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

variations.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2025-11-25
Patient: Stephen Hernandez
MRN: 8502923
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
New pleural effusion - diagnostic workup

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
None

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Thoracentesis performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
- Cell count with differential
- LDH, protein, glucose
- pH
- Cytology
- Gram stain and culture

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 32555

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-11-30, Sean Walker, a None-year-old patient (MRN 4644577), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for New pleural effusion - diagnostic workup. The patient received None and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included thoracentesis. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is pending. 

Procedural coding: 32555.
